intro: Sphyrastylis escobariana, commonly known as the Escobaria sphyrastylis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually modified into spines, reducing water loss and providing protection from herbivores. Sphyrastylis escobariana is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native habitat.
